apis.description: Returns the paginated list of files for the folder or course.

operations.notes: Returns the paginated list of files for the folder or course.

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: content_types
parameters.description: Filter results by content-type. You can specify type/subtype pairs (e.g., 'image/jpeg'), or simply types (e.g., 'image', which will match 'image/gif', 'image/jpeg', etc.).

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial name of the files to match and return.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Array of additional information to include. "user":: the user who uploaded the file or last edited its content "usage_rights":: copyright and license information for the file (see UsageRights)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort results by this field. Defaults to 'name'. Note that `sort=user` implies `include[]=user`.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The sorting order. Defaults to 'asc'.

apis.description: Update some settings on the specified file

operations.notes: Update some settings on the specified file

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new display name of the file

parameters.name: parent_folder_id
parameters.description: The id of the folder to move this file into. The new folder must be in the same context as the original parent folder. If the file is in a context without folders this does not apply.

parameters.name: on_duplicate
parameters.description: If the file is moved to a folder containing a file with the same name, or renamed to a name matching an existing file, the API call will fail unless this parameter is supplied. "overwrite":: Replace the existing file with the same name "rename":: Add a qualifier to make the new filename unique

parameters.name: lock_at
parameters.description: The datetime to lock the file at

parameters.name: unlock_at
parameters.description: The datetime to unlock the file at

parameters.name: locked
parameters.description: Flag the file as locked

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: Flag the file as hidden

apis.description:
Given the full path to a folder, returns a list of all Folders in the path hierarchy,
starting at the root folder, and ending at the requested folder. The given path is
relative to the context's root folder and does not include the root folder's name
(e.g., "course files"). If an empty path is given, the context's root folder alone
is returned. Otherwise, if no folder exists with the given full path, a Not Found
error is returned.

operations.notes:
Given the full path to a folder, returns a list of all Folders in the path hierarchy,
starting at the root folder, and ending at the requested folder. The given path is
relative to the context's root folder and does not include the root folder's name
(e.g., "course files"). If an empty path is given, the context's root folder alone
is returned. Otherwise, if no folder exists with the given full path, a Not Found
error is returned.

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

apis.description: Updates a folder

operations.notes: Updates a folder

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name of the folder

parameters.name: parent_folder_id
parameters.description: The id of the folder to move this folder into. The new folder must be in the same context as the original parent folder.

parameters.name: lock_at
parameters.description: The datetime to lock the folder at

parameters.name: unlock_at
parameters.description: The datetime to unlock the folder at

parameters.name: locked
parameters.description: Flag the folder as locked

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: Flag the folder as hidden

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Set an explicit sort position for the folder

apis.description: Creates a folder in the specified context

operations.notes: Creates a folder in the specified context

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the folder

parameters.name: parent_folder_id
parameters.description: The id of the folder to store the file in. If this and parent_folder_path are sent an error will be returned. If neither is given, a default folder will be used.

parameters.name: parent_folder_path
parameters.description: The path of the folder to store the new folder in. The path separator is the forward slash `/`, never a back slash. The parent folder will be created if it does not already exist. This parameter only applies to new folders in a context that has folders, such as a user, a course, or a group. If this and parent_folder_id are sent an error will be returned. If neither is given, a default folder will be used.

parameters.name: lock_at
parameters.description: The datetime to lock the folder at

parameters.name: unlock_at
parameters.description: The datetime to unlock the folder at

parameters.name: locked
parameters.description: Flag the folder as locked

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: Flag the folder as hidden

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Set an explicit sort position for the folder

apis.description:
Remove the specified folder. You can only delete empty folders unless you
set the 'force' flag

operations.notes:
Remove the specified folder. You can only delete empty folders unless you
set the 'force' flag

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to allow deleting a non-empty folder

apis.description:
Upload a file to a folder.

This API endpoint is the first step in uploading a file.
See the {file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on
the file upload workflow.

Only those with the "Manage Files" permission on a course or group can
upload files to a folder in that course or group.

operations.notes:
Upload a file to a folder.

This API endpoint is the first step in uploading a file.
See the {file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on
the file upload workflow.

Only those with the "Manage Files" permission on a course or group can
upload files to a folder in that course or group.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: ID

apis.description:
Copy a file from elsewhere in Canvas into a folder.

Copying a file across contexts (between courses and users) is permitted,
but the source and destination must belong to the same institution.

operations.notes:
Copy a file from elsewhere in Canvas into a folder.

Copying a file across contexts (between courses and users) is permitted,
but the source and destination must belong to the same institution.

parameters.name: dest_folder_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: source_file_id
parameters.description: The id of the source file

parameters.name: on_duplicate
parameters.description: What to do if a file with the same name already exists at the destination. If such a file exists and this parameter is not given, the call will fail. "overwrite":: Replace an existing file with the same name "rename":: Add a qualifier to make the new filename unique

apis.description:
Copy a folder (and its contents) from elsewhere in Canvas into a folder.

Copying a folder across contexts (between courses and users) is permitted,
but the source and destination must belong to the same institution.
If the source and destination folders are in the same context, the
source folder may not contain the destination folder. A folder will be
renamed at its destination if another folder with the same name already
exists.

operations.notes:
Copy a folder (and its contents) from elsewhere in Canvas into a folder.

Copying a folder across contexts (between courses and users) is permitted,
but the source and destination must belong to the same institution.
If the source and destination folders are in the same context, the
source folder may not contain the destination folder. A folder will be
renamed at its destination if another folder with the same name already
exists.

parameters.name: dest_folder_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: source_folder_id
parameters.description: The id of the source folder

apis.description: Sets copyright and license information for one or more files

operations.notes: Sets copyright and license information for one or more files

parameters.name: course_id
parameters.description: ID

parameters.name: file_ids
parameters.description: List of ids of files to set usage rights for.

parameters.name: folder_ids
parameters.description: List of ids of folders to search for files to set usage rights for. Note that new files uploaded to these folders do not automatically inherit these rights.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Whether the file(s) or folder(s) should be published on save, provided that usage rights have been specified (set to `true` to publish on save).

parameters.name: usage_rights[use_justification]
parameters.description: The intellectual property justification for using the files in Canvas

parameters.name: usage_rights[legal_copyright]
parameters.description: The legal copyright line for the files

parameters.name: usage_rights[license]
parameters.description: The license that applies to the files. See the {api:UsageRightsController#licenses List licenses endpoint} for the supported license types.

lock_explanation.example: This assignment is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

preview_url.description: optional: url to the document preview (only included in submission endpoints)

UsageRights.description: Describes the copyright and license information for a File

use_justification.description: Justification for using the file in a Canvas course. Valid values are 'own_copyright', 'public_domain', 'used_by_permission', 'fair_use', 'creative_commons'

file_ids.description: List of ids of files that were updated

id.description: a short string identifying the license

url.description: a link to the license text
